title: Wow. Great...
description: Wow. Great game. So clean yet lots of options to pursue.

title: Outstandin...
description: Outstanding game!  Have played 2, 3, 4 and 6 players.  Scales very nicely.  Might get to a 10 on my list.

title: A fascinat...
description: A fascinating take on worker-placement, where an auction is interleaved throughout. That said, it's devilishly hard to keep everyone else's villages' powers in mind, so there's some unavoidable obfuscation. That, and worker-placement is a very crowded and competitive field.

title: I just don...
description: I just don't seem to be able to plan ahead with this, in neither game did I feel any particular reason to bid on one hex over another.

title: What an ug...
description: What an ugly, non-sensical game. Happy to never play this again.

title: This game ...
description: This game does a little bit of everything and it does it well.

title: Keyflower ...
description:
Keyflower is a tile laying, logistics, resource conversion, partial information, bidding game. Although each of those features is very simplified, the combination makes for a fairly complex game that favors long-term planning.

The game has a few too many mechanics for my taste and your whole plan can go to waste if you build your strategy around scoring tiles that do not show up or don't manage to win during the bidding phase. Sure that may be considered as poor play, but sometimes it just looks like a player got lucky and managed to grab a tile that gave them a bunch of very cheap points. As happens with many multiplayer games, not all players are willing to sacrifice their position in order to prevent somebody else from getting something very cheap.

I really want to like the game. But I rather play many other games.

title: One of the...
description: One of the best multiplayer game which everyone engage, very pleasant first play

title: Not good f...
description: Not good for two players. Rather play with other games.

title: One of my ...
description: One of my favorite games to get to the table.  Works well at three or at six and in-between.  Two was still good, but not as much tension.

title: Really int...
description: Really interesting Euro that suffers a bit from an early snowball effect.  Your strategy has to constantly adapt based on what tiles get pulled out.  Unfortunately, this also causes some luck to be a factor in the game.  Unsure how I feel about this staying in my collection.

title: Wow. What ...
description: Wow. What a blend of great game mechanics! Art is a little bland. Rating might change with more plays.

title: Watched a ...
description:
Watched a review on this and it has sparked my interest in the game.

3.3.2014 Have played the base game a few times now and really enjoy this game. If interactive euro games are your thing, I would highly recommend that you try this out.  Bought the expansion.

After playing double digit games of this, this remains a top tier game for me.
Absolutely fantastic game, still you need to pick and choose your expansions.

title: I think th...
description: I think that it is just too heavy for me. When I tried it, there were too many possible places to set my meaples and all too often I was missing a great move just because it was on the board of a person on the other side of the table. Since I was so overwhelmed by the breadth of the decision tree, I was not even close to coming up with a good, viable strategy.

:thumbsup: [b]POSITIVE POINTS:[/b]

++ Fantastic take on auctions. The "color locking" of locations is an amazing mechanic.
++ Scales surprisingly well for an auction game.

:thumbsdown: [b]NEGATIVE POINTS:[/b]

-- Lots of small rules, it can be hard to teach/understand how they all interact. Takes a full game to see how everything comes together.
-- Can be a little fiddly setting up between seasons.

title: This is a ...
description: This is a tense and stressful game.  Reminds me a lot of the feeling I get while playing Power Grid.  My only real complaint is that the random meeple draws can be a little too critical in winter to rely on luck.  Fantastic game, all around.

title: Great game...
description:
Great game, looking forward to playing it more in the future. 

Had a terrible score because I was out bid on 3 different occasions.  Would bid differently know that i know how the flow of the game works.

title: No Review Title
description: No Review Description

title: Very dry m...
description:
Very dry mechanical buffet (auctions, tile laying worker placement, route building) that forms together into a run-of-the-mill resource conversion game.

The auction is kind of neat, but not interesting enough to make it stand out from the crowd of other games of its type.

title: How do you...
description: How do you even describe this game? Auctions, worker placement, route building, resource conversion, point salad scoring, hidden victory conditions, special player powers, and something about settlers?

title: Keyflower ...
description: Keyflower seamlessly incorporates so many mechanics and makes them seem like second nature. Great game that I want to play more often.
